articles.headline: Stymied by Protests, Iran Unleashes Its Wrath on Its Youth
articles.snippet: Hundreds of minors have been detained for joining the demonstrations, and many others have died in the crackdown, according to Iranian lawyers and rights activists.
articles.abstract: Hundreds of minors have been detained for joining the demonstrations, and many others have died in the crackdown, according to Iranian lawyers and rights activists.
articles.lead_paragraph: One girl, a 14-year-old, was incarcerated in an adult prison alongside drug offenders. A 16-year-old boy had his nose broken in detention after a beating by security officers. A 13-year-old girl was physically attacked by plainclothes militia who raided her school.

articles.headline: With Tensions Mounting, Biden and Xi Try a Warmer Tone
articles.snippet: The American and Chinese leaders invoked years of personal contact as they met before the G20, seeking to pull back from outright conflict on a host of issues.
articles.abstract: The American and Chinese leaders invoked years of personal contact as they met before the G20, seeking to pull back from outright conflict on a host of issues.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALI, Indonesia — After months of deepening contention between the United States and China, President Biden and President Xi Jinping met in person for the first time as national leaders on Monday with a tone of mutual engagement that acknowledged that both their countries faced challenges from global conflict and economic headwinds.
articles.byline: By Katie Rogers and Chris Buckley

articles.headline: McCarthy Scrounges for Support to Become Speaker as Republicans Feud
articles.snippet: After a historically bad midterm election for the G.O.P., the top House Republican tried to navigate infighting in his demoralized party.
articles.abstract: After a historically bad midterm election for the G.O.P., the top House Republican tried to navigate infighting in his demoralized party.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Representative Kevin McCarthy of California, the minority leader, scrounged on Monday for the support he would need to become speaker if Republicans gain control of the House, facing resistance from a newly emboldened right flank as his party grappled with its historically weak performance in the midterm elections.
articles.byline: By Catie Edmondson and Emily Cochrane

articles.headline: How Sam Bankman-Fried’s Crypto Empire Collapsed
articles.snippet: Mr. Bankman-Fried said in an interview that he had expanded too fast and failed to see warning signs. But he shared few details about his handling of FTX customers’ funds.
articles.abstract: Mr. Bankman-Fried said in an interview that he had expanded too fast and failed to see warning signs. But he shared few details about his handling of FTX customers’ funds.
articles.lead_paragraph: In less than a week, the cryptocurrency billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried went from industry leader to industry villain, lost most of his fortune, saw his $32 billion company plunge into bankruptcy and became the target of investigations by the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Justice Department.

articles.headline: Claims of Voter Fraud Build, but Not to Same Degree as in 2020
articles.snippet: False narratives failed to take root on Election Day. But several Republican candidates pointed to election fraud as their prospects worsened.
articles.abstract: False narratives failed to take root on Election Day. But several Republican candidates pointed to election fraud as their prospects worsened.
articles.lead_paragraph: It took a few days for people who have spent the past two years questioning the integrity of elections to find their voice.

articles.headline: Katie Hobbs, Who Defied Trump in Arizona, Tops Kari Lake for Governor
articles.snippet: Ms. Hobbs, Arizona’s secretary of state, narrowly defeated Ms. Lake, a former newscaster whose campaign was built on lies about the 2020 election.
articles.abstract: Ms. Hobbs, Arizona’s secretary of state, narrowly defeated Ms. Lake, a former newscaster whose campaign was built on lies about the 2020 election.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHOENIX — Katie Hobbs, who as Arizona’s secretary of state stood up to efforts by allies of former President Donald J. Trump to overturn the 2020 election, has clinched a victory in the state’s race for governor, according to The Associated Press.

articles.headline: As Europe Quits Russian Gas, Half of France’s Nuclear Plants Are Off-Line
articles.snippet: France’s state-backed nuclear operator is scrambling to overcome a monthslong crisis to get as many reactors as possible restarted before winter sets in.
articles.abstract: France’s state-backed nuclear operator is scrambling to overcome a monthslong crisis to get as many reactors as possible restarted before winter sets in.
articles.lead_paragraph: An army of engineers has fanned out through nuclear power plants across France in recent months, inspecting reactors for signs of wear and tear. Hundreds of expert welders have been recruited to repair problems found in cooling circuits. Stress tests are being conducted to check for safety problems.

articles.headline: Republicans’ 2022 Lesson: Voters Who Trust Elections Are More Likely to Vote
articles.snippet: Election deniers’ doubts about voting made for compelling conspiracy theories, but proved to be a bad get-out-the-vote strategy.
articles.abstract: Election deniers’ doubts about voting made for compelling conspiracy theories, but proved to be a bad get-out-the-vote strategy.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHOENIX — It was early on Election Day when polling places in Maricopa County started experiencing a glitch. Tabulation machines were rejecting thousands of ballots, a result of a printer error, and the confusion was causing lines and frustration at the polls.
articles.byline: By Jim Rutenberg and Nick Corasaniti

articles.headline: Walmart Defies Gloom Over Inflation With Sales and Profit Upgrade
articles.snippet: Ahead of the critical holiday shopping season, the nation’s largest retailer reported stronger-than-expected earnings and signaled confidence with a $20 billion share buyback.
articles.abstract: Ahead of the critical holiday shopping season, the nation’s largest retailer reported stronger-than-expected earnings and signaled confidence with a $20 billion share buyback.
articles.lead_paragraph: Walmart on Tuesday reported a rise in sales in its latest quarter, signaling that consumers continued to spend despite high inflation and that the retail behemoth had moved past the missteps that plagued it earlier this year. It also increased its full-year forecast for revenue and profit, and projected confidence by announcing a $20 billion share buyback.

articles.headline: Old Latin Mass Finds New American Audience, Despite Pope’s Disapproval
articles.snippet: An ancient form of Catholic worship is drawing in young traditionalists and conservatives. But it signals a divide within the church.
articles.abstract: An ancient form of Catholic worship is drawing in young traditionalists and conservatives. But it signals a divide within the church.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Eric Agustin’s eight children used to call the first day of the week “Party Sunday.” The family would wake up, attend a short morning Mass at a Catholic parish near their house, then head home for lunch and an afternoon of relaxing and watching football.
